FuncDef:
The nat log user enable command enables the NAT user log function.
The undo nat log user enable command disables the NAT user log function.
By default, the NAT user log function is disabled.
CLIs: nat log user enable [ syslog | netstream ]
undo nat log user enable [ syslog | netstream ]

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates NAT user logs in the syslog format.
-

Indicates NAT user logs in the NetStream format.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To enable the NAT log function, run the nat log user enable command. The log function helps record intranet users' access to external networks in real time, enhancing network maintainability. Running the nat log user enable command is a prerequisite for configuring NAT user logs.
Precautions
After running the nat log user enable command, run the nat log host command to configure a log host to parse user logs.
When the nat log user enable command without a format configured is run, the syslog flow log format is used by default for NAT user logs.
If this command is run on a device on which the port range mode is configured, the device sends user logs when users get online, get offline, are assigned ports, and release ports. If this command is run on a device on which a non-port range mode is configured, the device sends user logs when a no-PAT address pool is used and users get online and offline.
This command is applicable only to the VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S.
